sen.j: 上野 清信（うえの きよのぶ、生没年不詳）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Kiyonobu UENO (year of birth and death unknown) was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 父は幕臣にて旧備中国鬼邑山城城主 上野信孝。
sen.e: His father was Nobutaka UENO, a Shogun's retainer and the lord of the Kimurayama-jo Castle in old Bicchu Province.

sen.j: 弟は上野頼久、上野右衛門尉。
sen.e: His brother included Yorihisa UENO and Uemon no jo UENO.

sen.j: 官位は中務少輔従五位。

sen.j: 父 上野信孝は足利義稙の近臣として、明応の政変において征夷大将軍を追われた義稙に随行して西国に下り、備中国鬼邑山城主に任ぜられた武将であった。
sen.e: His father, Nobutaka UENO was a Busho, who, as a trusted vassal of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, went down to Saigoku (western part of Japan (especially Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)) with Yoshitane being driven out of his position of Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Coup of Meio and was appointed the lord of the Kimurayama-jo Castle in Bicchu Province.

sen.j: 父は一門の上野高直を鬼邑山城主とし、次男 上野頼久を備中国松山城 (備中国)に任じて、嫡男 清信を伴い、京都帰洛した。
sen.e: His father made Takanao UENO of his family the lord of the Kimurayama-jo Castle in Bicchu Province, made his second son, Yorihisa UENO the lord of the Matsuyama-jo Castle (Bicchu Province) and went back to Kyoto with his eldest legitimate son, Kiyonobu.

sen.j: 以後、清信は父とともに室町幕府に出仕し足利将軍家に仕える。
sen.e: Afterward, Kiyonobu worked with his father at Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) serving the Ashikaga Shogun Family.

sen.j: 清信は、13代将軍 足利義輝が従弟 足利義栄を奉じる三好義継、三好三人衆・松永久秀の軍勢に討たれ、義輝の実弟 足利義昭に追跡の手が及ぶと、義昭に随行し越前国の朝倉義景の下に逃れた。
sen.e: When the 13th Shogun, Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was killed by the army of Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI, Miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) and Hisahide MATSUNAGA having Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, his younger cousin, at their head and then Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, Yoshiteru's real younger brother was pursued, Kiyonobu followed Yoshiaki to escape to Echizen Province for help of Yoshikage ASAKURA.

sen.j: 朝倉氏の膝元 一乗谷城に逗留後、義昭をして将軍義栄討伐の兵を挙げることを求めるものの、朝倉義景が一向に動かなかった。
sen.e: After staying at Ichijodani Castle, the headquarters of Asakura clan, Kiyonobu asked Yoshikage ASAKURA to raise an army with Yoshiaki as its head to attack Shogun Yoshihide, but Yoshikage did not act at all.

sen.j: 義昭は尾張国の織田信長の保護を受け、織田軍の加勢により将軍職を奪還、京都に入洛し清信はこれに随行した。
sen.e: Yoshiaki came to be protected by Nobunaga ODA of Owari Province, received reinforcements by the Oda army, recaptured Shogunate and when he entered into Kyoto, Kiyonobu followed him.

sen.j: その後、信長と義昭の対立が深め、幕命によって形成された信長包囲網が信長の手によって崩された。
sen.e: Afterward, due to the confrontation between Nobunaga and Yoshiaki intensifying, anti-Nobunaga network was formed by the order of the Bakufu, but it was destroyed by Nobunaga.

sen.j: 幕府に迫る織田軍を前に、清信は義昭の面前で徹底抗戦を訴え、降伏を唱える細川幽斎と口論に及んだという。
sen.e: While the Oda army was closing in on the Bakufu, Kiyonobu insisted on all-out resistance and reportedly got into a quarrel in spite of the presence of Yoshiaki with Yusai HOSOKAWA who advocated surrender.

sen.e: However, when Muromachi bakufu was overthrown in 1573 and Yoshiaki came under the protection of the Mori clan, Kiyonobu left him and started to serve Nobunaga.
